attributes.action: Bar the Conservative MP Philip Davies, from speaking in debates for 12 months.
attributes.background: Philip Davies, spoke for more than 90 minutes in the House of Commons on Friday in an attempt to derail a vote on ratifying a treaty on domestic violence. Filibustering is an archaic, undemocratic practice that allows MPs to block debate on important issues.  It has no place in a modern parliament.

rejection.details:
The UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for banning MPs from speaking in debates.

You may wish to sign this petition instead:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/187547
